intro: Pyrrothrix hossei, commonly known as the Hosse's pyrrothrix, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features include a slender stem and white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
